checks.title: Orphaned rows (child without parent)

checks.title: Nullable foreign key columns

checks.title: Cascade delete/update rules
checks.message: 1 FK(s) use non-NO_ACTION; review intent: dbo.Attorneys.FK__Attorneys__FirmI__5812160E → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.Attorneys.FK_Attorneys_PrimaryCase → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.BillingEntries.FK__BillingEn__Attor__6E01572D → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.BillingEntries.FK__BillingEn__CaseI__6D0D32F4 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.CaseNotes.FK__CaseNotes__CaseI__68487DD7 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.Cases.FK__Cases__ClientId__5AEE82B9 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.Cases.FK__Cases__LeadAttor__5BE2A6F2 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.CaseSummaries.FK__CaseSumma__CaseI__5FB337D6 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.ClientProfiles.FK__ClientPro__Clien__628FA481 → DELETE:NO_ACTION, UPDATE:NO_ACTION; dbo.CourtSessions.FK__CourtSess__CaseI__656C112C → DELETE:CASCADE, UPDATE:NO_ACTION
checks.whatsWrong: Found 10 foreign key(s) using cascade rules
checks.whyItMatters: Cascade rules automatically delete or update rows—confirm this is what you want.
checks.whatToDoNext: Review each FK in Details; change to NO_ACTION if you don't want automatic updates or deletes.

checks.title: Circular foreign key dependencies
checks.message: Circular FK dependency detected: dbo.Attorneys; dbo.Cases
checks.whatsWrong: Circular foreign key dependency involving 2 table(s)
checks.whyItMatters: Circular references can complicate insert order and schema changes.
checks.whatToDoNext: Consider restructuring—e.g. nullable FK or junction table—to break the cycle (see Details).

checks.title: One-to-one relationship missing unique constraint
checks.message: FK column may represent 1:1; add UNIQUE if so: dbo.Attorneys.FirmId; dbo.Attorneys.PrimaryCaseId; dbo.BillingEntries.AttorneyId; dbo.BillingEntries.CaseId; dbo.CaseNotes.CaseId; dbo.Cases.ClientId; dbo.Cases.LeadAttorneyId; dbo.CaseSummaries.CaseId; dbo.ClientProfiles.ClientId; dbo.CourtSessions.CaseId
checks.whatsWrong: Found 10 foreign key column(s) that may represent one-to-one without a UNIQUE constraint
checks.whyItMatters: Without UNIQUE, the database allows multiple rows to reference the same parent. Add UNIQUE if it's truly one-to-one.
checks.whatToDoNext: Add a UNIQUE constraint on the foreign key column(s) in Details if the relationship is one-to-one.

checks.title: Polymorphic reference columns (type + id) without foreign key
checks.message: Polymorphic-style columns with no FK; integrity not enforced: dbo.Documents: documentable_type, documentable_id
checks.whatsWrong: Found 1 polymorphic reference(s) (type + id pair) with no foreign key
checks.whyItMatters: When one id column can point to different table types, the database can't enforce referential integrity.
checks.whatToDoNext: Document your validation rules, or use concrete foreign keys or separate columns per type (see Details).

checks.title: Tables with many nullable columns

checks.whyItMatters: Too many nullable columns can make queries and reporting harder, and may suggest unclear design.

checks.title: Junction tables without composite key
